other_tests.findings: Absent sensory responses of the upper and lower limbs with demyelinating features of the motor responses. Markedly prolonged motor distal latencies (16–27 ms in arms, 14–26 ms in legs) and marked prolonged compound muscle action potential durations.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up nerve conduction study 9 months later showed profound improvement of distal latency, amplitude, and duration, including temporal dispersion and conduction velocity.

other_tests.findings: Abnormal spontaneous activity in the form of fibrillation potentials in the distal legs and long-duration, high-amplitude, polyphasic motor unit potentials with reduced recruitment in all tested muscles.
CSF protein was 70 mg/dL, CSF glucose was normal, cell count was 0.
Mild enhancement of the cervical and lumbar roots.
